direction: Direction (Q.No. 1)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The 'T' shaped large element rotates 90oCW in each step. The two small symbols interchange positions and the symbol that reaches the upper position gets replaced by a new one.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 2 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each step, all the existing curves get inverted and one of the line segments gets converted to a curve.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 2 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: One of the designs (with white triangle at the centre) moves CW while the other design (with black triangle at the centre) moves ACW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 2 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The symbols move in sequencesandalternately. In each step, the symbol that reaches the encircled position gets replaced by a new symbol.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 8)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The inner element gets enlarged, rotates 45oCW and becomes the outer element. The outer element reduces in size, gets vertically inverted and becomes the inner element.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 8)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. answer_description: The figure gets divided into eight equal parts.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 8)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: An element similar to but smaller than the outer element appears as the inner element and it hides the parts of the line segments that come under it.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 8)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. answer_description: The LHS element rotates 90oACW and moves to the upper position. The lower element rotates 90oACW and gets laterally inverted and moves to the LHS position.

answer_description: The right half of the figure is lost and the remaining portion is shaded.

answer_description: The figure rotates 90oCW and the number of straight lines or arcs at the centre increases by one.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 9 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The figure gets laterally inverted.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 9 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. answer_description: The upper and the lower elements interchange places; the element that reaches the upper position gets laterally inverted; the element that reaches the lower position gets laterally inverted and its head also gets laterally inverted; the line segment inside the square (central element) rotates 45oCW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 9 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The upper-right, lower-right and lower-left half-shaded squares rotate 90oCW while the middle-right and lower-middle half-shaded squares rotate 90oACW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 17)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: All other figures are divided into equal parts.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 17)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: All other figures can be rotated into each other. (In each figurer except fig, (1), the middle element is obtained by rotating the outer element through 90oCW and the inner element is obtained by rotating the middle element through 90oCW).

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 17)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In all other figures, the arrow and the V sign lie towards the black end of the main figure.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 18 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Only in fig. (3), two out of the four elements are opening in the same direction.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 18 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each one of the figures except fig. (3), the numbers of different types of elements are in a sequence such as there are three '=' signs, four circles, five 'C'-shaped elements and six V signs in fig. (1).

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 18 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In all other figures, none of the elements in at the central position and all the elements are arranged at the outer positions with the two types of elements appearing alternately.
